transcript.title: FOR PRESS: PM 38/1963 - DEATH OF NEW ZEALAND HIGH COMMISSIONER IN AUSTRALIA - STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, THE RT. HON. SIR ROBERT MENZIES
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS: P. M. NO. 38/ 1263
DEATH OF NEW ZEALAND HIGH COMMISSIONER IN
AUSTRALIA
Statement by the Prime Minister, the Rt. Hon. Sir Robert
Menzie s
I heard the news immediately after my arrival
in Melbourne this morning and I was deeply shocked by it.
Mr. Johnston was a splendid representative
of his country, well-informed, easy and friendly. It is
a tragedy that he should be cut off in the middle of his
service to our sister country at a time when he seemed to
have many years of public-spirited life left to him.
:. Ieex tend our very deep sympathy to his w. idow
and family.
CANBER. RA, 7
May, 1963.
